text: To avoid derailing the other thread: how would I go about adding my packages to BioJulia?

elements.text: To avoid derailing the other thread: how would I go about adding my packages to BioJulia?

text: You need to transer the repo: <https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/transferring-a-repository>

elements.text: You need to transer the repo:

text: I think I need to give you access to create repos. I've just sent an invitation to BioJulia to you. Perhaps you need to accept it before I can grant that

elements.text: I think I need to give you access to create repos. I've just sent an invitation to BioJulia to you. Perhaps you need to accept it before I can grant that

text: It would be nicer if the package had a similar interface to the other BioJulia parsers - namely, that it had a `Reader` and a `Writer` that was subtypes of `AbstractFormattedStream` , buffered with `TranscodingStreams` , and which, when iterated, yielded `Record` objects

elements.text: It would be nicer if the package had a similar interface to the other BioJulia parsers - namely, that it had a
Reader
and a
Writer
that was subtypes of
AbstractFormattedStream
, buffered with
TranscodingStreams
, and which, when iterated, yielded
Record
objects

text: But I understand that it would be a major operation to change the interface like that.

elements.text: But I understand that it would be a major operation to change the interface like that.

text: I agree. I’ll have a look, and if I think I can do it in a reasonable amount of time I’ll do it before transferring the repo.

elements.text: I agree. I’ll have a look, and if I think I can do it in a reasonable amount of time I’ll do it before transferring the repo.

text: Please feel free to ask around here. I think the precise interface for readers and such may not be well documented. I've never implemented one myself. We should also clean that up sometime

elements.text: Please feel free to ask around here. I think the precise interface for readers and such may not be well documented. I've never implemented one myself. We should also clean that up sometime

text:
I think ok to transfer and then open an issue to unify interface as well. Or not - feel free to tag me in an issue if I can help as well.

I saw DaraFrames in your deps too - depending on that you use it for, it might be nice to convert it to Tables.jl for better interop, which I also have a bit of experience with.

elements.text:
I think ok to transfer and then open an issue to unify interface as well. Or not - feel free to tag me in an issue if I can help as well.

I saw DaraFrames in your deps too - depending on that you use it for, it might be nice to convert it to Tables.jl for better interop, which I also have a bit of experience with.

text: DataFrames was just the most convenient option when I created the package. Tables.jl didn’t exist at that point AFAICT. I’ll keep it in mind, but it isn’t high priority for me at the moment.

elements.text: DataFrames was just the most convenient option when I created the package. Tables.jl didn’t exist at that point AFAICT. I’ll keep it in mind, but it isn’t high priority for me at the moment.

text: Oh, yeah. Definitely not a priority :smile:. DataFrames is super convenient - I used it in one of my packages for a long time and only recently made the shift.

elements.text: Oh, yeah. Definitely not a priority
. DataFrames is super convenient - I used it in one of my packages for a long time and only recently made the shift.
